He works hard that he may pass the examination.
He managed to pass the examination.
Do you think that he will pass the examination?
He contrived to cheat in the examination.
ko: 걔 어떻게든 시험에서 커닝하려고 머리 좀 썼어요.

en: He got the highest grade on the exam.
He failed in the examination.
He was caught cheating in the exam.
He scored 85 on the exam.
He cheated on the test by copying from the girl in front.
ko: 걔 앞에 앉은 여자애 거 보고 커닝했어요.

en: He did well in the examination.
He tried writing a short story.
ko: 걔 단편 소설을 한번 써 봤어요.

en: He tried climbing the distant mountain.
ko: 저 멀리 있는 산에 한번 올라가 봤어요.

en: He tried opening the door.
He tried solving the problem.
He took the car on trial.
He decided to give it a try.
He is anything but a poet.
He hoped to find fame as a poet.
ko: 걔는 시인으로 명성을 얻고 싶어 했어요.

en: He is not so much a poet as a writer.
He is not so much a poet as a novelist.
He is a poet and statesman.
He isn't a poet; he's a prose writer.
In addition to being a poet, he is a scholar.
He is a poet and novelist.
He is a poet.
He was learning a poem.
His eyes failed him.
He lost his eyesight.
He has poor eyesight.
He kept quite calm.
He has good eyesight.
He was welcomed everywhere.
He drew some vertical lines on the paper.
ko: 걔는 종이에 세로줄을 몇 개 그었어요.

en: He wrote a sentence on the paper, but I didn't understand the sentence.
ko: 걔가 종이에 문장을 하나 썼는데, 무슨 뜻인지 모르겠더라고요.

en: He is always busy feathering his own nest.
ko: 걔는 항상 자기 잇속 챙기느라 바빠요.

en: He kept us waiting for a long time.
ko: 걔가 우리를 아주 오래 기다리게 했어.

en: He is no more able to read Chinese than I am.
Is he going to help us?
He works us too hard.
He is the man for whom we all have respect.
He is our next door neighbor.
He lives next door to us.
He flatly turned down our request.
ko: 걔가 우리 부탁을 딱 잘라 거절했어.

en: He came up with an answer to our problem.
ko: 걔가 우리 문제에 대한 답을 찾아냈어.

en: He failed to come up to our expectations.
He is popular among us.
He passes for a learned man in our community.
ko: 걔는 우리 동네에서 유식한 사람으로 통해.

en: He teaches us history.
He has given us useful knowledge.
He is very friendly to us.
He gave us clothes, and money as well.
ko: 걔가 우리한테 옷도 주고 돈도 줬어.

en: He is very formal with us.
ko: 걔는 우리를 너무 격식 있게 대해.

en: He asked us not to make any noise.
ko: 걔가 우리한테 시끄럽게 하지 말라고 했어.

en: He showed us some pictures.
ko: 걔가 우리한테 사진 몇 장을 보여줬어.

en: He preached to us about the importance of good health.
ko: 걔는 우리한테 건강이 얼마나 중요한지 설교하더라.

en: He gave us an essay to write during the vacation.
ko: 걔가 우리한테 방학 동안 쓸 에세이 숙제를 내줬어.

en: I thought he held something back from us.
ko: 걔가 우리한테 뭔가 숨기고 있다고 생각했어.

en: He teaches us English.
He came across to us as being honest.
He suggested we should start at once.
He demanded that we leave at once.
He is a different person from the one we are looking for.
He turned down my application.
He sat at a distance from me.
He crossed me up.
He is doing it with my help.
ko: 걔는 내 도움을 받아서 그거 하고 있어.

en: In addition to hiring me, he gave me a piece of advice.
ko: 걔는 나를 뽑은 것뿐만 아니라 조언도 해줬어.

en: He called me by name.
He forced me to go.
I was made to go against my will.
ko: 나는 가기 싫었는데 억지로 가게 됐어.

en: He wrote to me to the effect that he would visit me.
ko: 걔가 자기가 나를 보러 오겠다는 식으로 편지를 썼어.

en: He hustled me into the house.
ko: 걔가 나를 집 안으로 재빨리 밀어 넣었어.

en: He charged me with dishonesty.
He introduced me to his parents.
ko: 걔가 나를 자기 부모님께 소개해 줬어.

en: He made me attend the party in his place.
ko: 걔가 나보고 자기 대신 파티에 가라고 했어.

en: He let me work in this office.
ko: 걔가 나를 이 사무실에서 일하게 해줬어.

en: He gave me a lift in his cart.
He went so far as to call me a fool.
As he played a dirty trick on me, I'll get even with him.
ko: 걔가 나한테 치사한 짓을 했으니까, 나도 똑같이 갚아줄 거야.

en: He flatly refused to let me in.
ko: 걔가 나를 못 들어오게 딱 잘라 거절했어.

en: He doesn't know me.
He made believe not to know me.
He pretended not to know me.
Does he know me?
He treats me as an adult.
He kept me waiting.
His constant insults aroused my anger.
ko: 걔가 계속 모욕해서 나 진짜 화났어.
